data.title: Great food for a Great price.
data.text: The owner will make you feel at home!  Just be prepared as she'll dish out some fun banter with you...she is a hoot!

data.title: Homecooked food
data.text: great breakfast.  Owner will know you name if you go there twice.  Small town feel in a big city.  Too much food is my only complaint.  Can never finish anything I order

data.title: This is how you do it...
data.text: Friendly and family run, these folks understand what a diner is supposed to be. Then they go a step above by constantly alternating specials and perfecting their menu items. Delicious burgers in ample varieties, amazing breakfasts, just a great place to have a cup of coffee. I'm an eggs benedict fan - each of their variations has been delicious. Just that they offer variations keeps me returning. Breakfast sweetbreads are second to none. Most notably the bananas foster french toast and the cinnamon roll pancake. You won't be disappointed at any time of day.

data.title: Hit and miss
data.text: We enjoy supporting local businesses and eat here from time to time.  The food quality is hit and miss.  One time it will be good and the next just ok.   Service can be hit and miss as well.  I guess we have enough good experiences to come back from time to time but not the top of my list for local restaurants.

data.title: Quick breakfas
data.text:
Small business owners working hard... Owners were cooking and waiting tables. Nice to see hard working business owners and very customer friendly. 
The only complaint is the place could use some updating. Booth seats are very old and fabric is cut or ripped. Not a smooth flow to walk from table to restroom a lot of zig zagging. 
Overall basic diner and decent food.

data.title: Perfect Diner-Style Experience
data.text:
My family met here for a multi-birthday breakfast celebration. Seven adults, seven happy guests! 

The service was great, the entire staff was friendly, prices were good, and the food was delicious. We liked the fun and funky diner feel, as well.

We each ordered a different version of eggs Benedict. They had so many great variations to choose from. Portions are huge! One tasty pancake is bigger than a dinner plate! Don't be shy to ask for a to-go box. 

We'll definitely go out of our way to go back soon. It's the type of place that can easily create cravings!

data.title: Bad food, high prices
data.text:
Save yourself and go to First Watch instead.
I went there for breakfast and no one was there.  No one.  That should have tipped me off.  I checked out the menu and noticed the prices were a little higher than I thought but I wanted to give it a try.  I ordered an omelet and small oj.  The server brought out a gigantic oj and informed me that was their only size.  OK.  $2.75 for oj.  Then she brought me an omelet I couldn't eat.  Well, I could have eaten it but I didn't want to. I tried it, sent it back, left a tip for the poor server and called it a day.

data.title: Solid diner food
data.text: Large portions, good price, decent taste.  The quality of the food won't blow you away.  In fact you could probably make something better at home.  But sometimes you need a good homecooked meal that was cooked by someone else, and Downtown Diner won't disappoint.

data.title: Review
data.text: 3 of us ate dinner here. I had the chicken fry, my son the patty melt and his GF had the country fried steak.  . For the money, i think we should've had larger portions. The food was good though. If i come back, i will try one of the burgers.

data.title: Good breakfast
data.text: Eggs over easy, crispy bacon, wheat toast and an unending glass of iced tea.  Good service, food served quickly and perfectly prepared.  Looks like an extensive breakfast menu.  Only open a few days a week.  Will return

data.title: Great Breakfast and Lunch
data.text: The Downtown Diner is a place that reminds me of the hometown diners I grew up with in rural locations.  They have a great diversified menu.  I have only eaten here for breakfast (favorite meal) and lunch.  I have eaten here on multiple occasions and they are usually packed when I am there.  Service can be slow at times due to the number of people in the restaurant; however, I bring something to read and they keep my coffee cup full.  It is veteran owned and frequented by veterans.  I do not come for "fast food", I come for the atmosphere and what I consider great food.  Looking forward to my next visit, which will be soon.

data.title: Best Eggs Benedict Ever!
data.text:
My wife loved her PB & J French Toast! And the service was Excellent! 
Just a short drive off of I-35....

data.title: Great Breakfast!
data.text: Hometown feel and great friendly service! Try the Haystack for breakfast! They also have huge cinnamon rolls!

data.title: Cheap Dinner! Great Diner food!
data.text: Fabulous food and a patient wait staff.  We were a family of 8 and they took care of us beautifully! The food was top notch.  My 17 year old son is still raving about it.

data.title: Average Food---Location good
data.text: OK if you need a quick breakfast or lunch.  Nothing special about this place.  Location is close to the courthouse if you have business there..

data.title: Great small town diner!
data.text:
This place doesn't look like much but if you love good comfort food, you MUST go to Downtown Diner. This gem serves the best (and biggest) pancakes I've ever had and are made with real cream for the perfect sweet taste. The French Toast is to die for, too. There are a number of delicious skillet type choices as well. 
If breakfast isn't your thing, check out the wacky variety of burgers including one that Elvis would love complete with peanut butter & banana! You can also have standard diner fare for the less adventurous palate.
Family owned & operated which means personalized service and great small town hospitality.

data.title: Enjoyed breakfast
data.text: We visited with friends one sunday. Food was excellent with very generous portion. Our waitress was very new and having trouble getting things going for several tables. I did feel sorry but I was hungry. The owner was keeping track and waited on us as we were discussing plans to leave. I'll go back again...no matter what cuisine the owners have offered through the years they have done it well

data.title: Yummy breakfast!
data.text: During my visit to Olathe we stopped in for breakfast one morning. The food was awesome! There was only one server (apparently that's normal) but she gets the food out pretty quickly. I ordered the train wreck (eggs, hash browns, bacon, ham, and sausage all smothered with gravy and cheese) and it was amazing. You get plenty of food but not so much that you waste it. Definitely worth a visit!

data.title: Great breakfast!
data.text: The food is always good. We usually eat there for breakfast . We did have their lunch special smoked chicken and it was excellent. Most of the time there is only one person waiting tables and running the register but she does it well! Great place!!

data.title: BREAKFAST
data.text: This is in my opinion the BEST restaurant to go for breakfast!!! The service is great, and my eggas are always PERFECT!!!
